title: THE KARMIC EFFECT
text:
Does karma of parents affect children and how does it work? — Neha S



■ The karma of parents cannot be transferred or inherited by a child. Since children are dependent, they are most likely to adopt their parents’ behaviour. As a result they will land up facing the consequences of their parents’ behaviour. They are likely to face negativity or positivity depending on their parents’ karma.



This does not mean karma has been passed to the child. For instance, if a person builds a house and lives in it with his family, everyone enjoys living in the house, but the house is owned by the parent only.



Karma instructs: we reap what we sow. That means we must eventually face the consequences of actions we did in our past. Every individual brings along his own fate and destiny, which may come into effect now or later. However, karmic timing is a curious thing. And you are the one who will face the actual consequences of your past actions.



We all have our own karmic account and we get a life according to that. But if we become part or reason for other’s happiness and sadness, then we also accumulate or become part of that karma.



The karma of parents in the current life does not affect their child’s karma, unless the child chooses to follow in the steps of the parents.
